intro: Origanum amanum, commonly known as Turkish oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its essential oils, rich in thymol and carvacrol, contribute to its strong aroma and medicinal properties. Origanum amanum is often used in culinary applications and traditional herbal remedies.
